N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 510.5 - Designation and responsibilities of records access officers

State Regulations
(a) The records
access officer of the Office of Mental Health's (OMH) central office shall be a
lawyer in the office of counsel, designated by the Commissioner. The address
for the records access officer is 44 Holland Avenue, Albany, New York 12229. The records access officer of each OMH operated psychiatric center is the
facility director or his or her designee, who may be contacted at the business
address of the applicable psychiatric center. (b) The records access officer is responsible
for: (1)
maintaining a reasonably detailed
current list, by subject matter, of records maintained by the
organization; (2)
assisting the
requester in identifying requested records, if necessary; (3)
determining the appropriateness of public
access to requested records; (4)
providing documents to persons who have been granted access; and
(5)
documenting denials of requests for
access and maintaining a file of such denials. Notes
